各保健所の電話番号は福祉保健局HP: Click here to see contact information for local public health centers (TMG Bureau of Social Welfare and Public Health website).
平日（夜間）: 午後5時から翌朝午前9時/土日祝 終日: Weekdays (5:00 p.m. to 9:00 a.m.) and weekends/holidays (all hours)
上記の症状に当てはまらない方は、新型コロナコールセンターにご相談ください。: If you do not have these symptoms, contact the Tokyo COVID-19 Call Center.
医師が検査の必要性を判断いたします。: A doctor will determine the need for a test.
マスクをして公共交通機関をできるだけ使わずに受診をしてください。: Wear a mask and avoid public transportation if possible.
医師により検査が必要だと判断されPCR検査（東京都健康安全研究センター等）を受け: After a doctor determines that a test is needed, you receive a PCR test at the Tokyo Metropolitan Institute of Public Health or elsewhere, and you:
感染症指定医療機関等への入院、又は宿泊施設等での療養となります: You will be admitted to a designated medical institution for infectious diseases or a designated hotel for recovery. Other quarantine arrangements may also be possible.
ただし、症状が良くならない場合は再度受診相談窓口またはかかりつけ医に相談してくだ: If your symptoms do not improve, consult your doctor or the Tokyo COVID-19 Consultation Hotline.
自分や家族の症状に不安や心配があればまずは電話相談をどうぞ: Consult over the phone first if you have any concerns

不特定多数の人の集まる場所等への外出を避け、基本的に自宅で過ごしてください。: Avoid going out, especially to places where many people gather.
手洗い、咳エチケット等により、感染予防に努めてください。: Make efforts to prevent infection by taking precautions such as frequent handwashing and good cough etiquette.
【参考】感染症予防のための正しい手洗い方法（動画）: Instructional video on the correct way to wash hands to prevent infection
規則正しい生活を心がけ、日常の健康管理に十分気を付けてください。: Make efforts to maintain a normal schedule and pay special attention to maintaining daily health.
感染症を疑う場合の対応: What to do if you believe your child may be infected
各保健所にご相談ください: If your child displays symptoms such as difficulty breathing, serious fatigue, a high fever, or if relatively mild cold symptoms such as a fever or cough persist, please call your local public health center.

当サイトは新型コロナウイルス感染症 (COVID-19) に関する最新情報を提供: This site was established by the Tokyo Metropolitan Government to provide the latest information related to COVID-19.
東京都による公式情報と客観的な数値をわかりやすく伝えることで、東京都にお住まいの: By presenting official information issued by the Tokyo Metropolitan Government and objective figures in a simple format, this site aims to enable Tokyo residents, visitors, and companies based in the city to grasp the current situation and take proper measures.
Google Chrome 最新版（Windows 10以上, Android: Google Chrome latest version (Windows 10 or later, Android 8.0 or later)
※ 推奨環境以外で利用された場合や、推奨環境下でもご利用のブラウザの設定等によっ: Please understand that this website may not display correctly when using a browser that is not recommended, or when browser settings are incompatible.
当サイトへのリンクは自由です。: Anyone can link to this website.
JavaScriptを無効にして使用された場合、各ページが正常に動作しない、また: If JavaScript is disabled, the pages may not properly function or display.
当サイトをご利用の際には、JavaScriptを有効にして頂きますようお願いいた: Please make sure that JavaScript is enabled when using this site.
クッキーとは、Webコンテンツからの要求で利用者の手元の端末に一時的に保存される: A cookie is data sent from a website and temporarily stored on the user's computer. On this site, cookies may be used to track website activity.
ブラウザに関する情報の収集を希望しない場合は、インターネット閲覧ソフト（ブラウザ: If you do not wish for your browsing data to be collected, you can disable cookies by changing your web browser settings.
ただし、クッキーを受け入れない設定をされている場合は、当サイトの機能が正常に動作: However, if you disable cookies, some of the functions of this site may not work correctly.
Google Analyticsの利用について: About the use of Google Analytics
当サイトでは、サービス向上やサイトの改善のためにGoogle LLCの提供するア: This site uses Google Analytics, an analytics service provided by Google LLC, to track website activity for site improvement and provision of better services.
Google Analyticsでは、当サイトが発行するクッキー (Cookie: Google Analytics uses cookies from this site to collect anonymous usage data (page views, traffic, browser, IP address information, etc.). We use cookies in accordance with Google's privacy policy and terms.
取得したデータはWebサイト利用状況を分析しサービスの改善につなげるため、または: The collected data will only be used to analyze website usage for the improvement of services, to create reports for the site administrator, or other purposes related to the provision of services.  (In the reports for site administrators, cookies are used to count visitors to the site by browser, and IP addresses are used to ascertain visitor regional distribution (country, state/prefecture, city) through Google Analytics.)
Google Analyticsの利用規約及びプライバシーポリシーに関する説明に: For more about Google Analytics Terms of Service and Privacy Policy, please visit the Google Analytics site.
Google Analyticsによる情報送信を回避する場合は、Google が: If you want to avoid sending information by Google Analytics, please use {addon} supported by Google.
測定を無効にするブラウザ アドオン: the browser add-on which disables data collection
当サイトに掲載されている情報の正確性については万全を期していますが、東京都は利用: Although every effort has been made to ensure the accuracy of the information posted on this site, the Tokyo Metropolitan Government will not be responsible for any action taken by those using the information on this site.
また、利用者が当サイトを利用したことにより発生した利用者の損害及び利用者が第三者: The Tokyo Metropolitan Government will not be responsible for any damage that may occur to a user or damage that the user may cause to a third party, as a result of using this website.
当サイトに掲載されている情報は、予告なしに変更又は削除することがあります。: The information on this site may be subject to change or deletion without prior notice.
本サイトで公表しているデータは、{catalogWebsite}より誰でも自由に: Anyone can download the data made available on this website from {catalogWebsite}. (Data is planned to be added as it becomes available.).

新型コロナウイルス感染拡大防止のため、都の要請や協力依頼に応じて、施設の使用停止: Tokyo will provide aid to small and medium-sized businesses that fully cooperate with requests to close facilities or shorten business hours to prevent the spread of COVID-19. The amount is 500,000 yen (1 million yen for businesses observing these measures at 2 or more locations).

妊娠中の方、重症化しやすい方（高齢者、糖尿病、心不全、呼吸器疾患（COPD等）等: Call immediately if you are pregnant, elderly, or have an underlying condition (diabetes, heart failure, a respiratory condition such as COPD, etc.), which could lead to the development of severe symptoms. In addition, call immediately if you are undergoing kidney dialysis, on an immunosuppressant or cancer-fighting drug, etc. If you do not fall into the aforementioned categories, call if symptoms persist four days or more.
新型コロナ受診相談窓口、またはかかりつけ医によって新型コロナ外来（帰国者・接触者: If the Novel Coronavirus Hotline or your primary care physician determines that you need to visit a COVID-19 outpatient consultation facility (for returnees with suspected symptoms and those in close contact with them) or a PCR test center.
（上記の症状がない場合も、不安に思う方は、日ごろ受診されている医療機関に電話でご: (If you are concerned, please call your regular doctor or medical institution, even if you do not have any of the aforementioned symptoms.)
症状には個人差がありますので、強い症状と思う場合にはすぐに相談してください。解熱: Symptoms vary widely. If you think your symptoms are severe, or if you must continuously rely on a fever reducer or other medication to manage your symptoms, call immediately.

上記の考え方で重症患者数の計上を開始した4月27日から作成: The graph starts from April 27 when figures for severe patients were first tabulated based on the above description.
当サイトにおいて入院患者数の公表を開始した3月6日から作成: The graph starts on March 6th, from when the number of hospitalized patients was first published on this website.
入院患者数のうち、集中治療室（ICU）等での管理又は人工呼吸器管理が必要な患者数: Within hospitalized patients, "serious symptoms" are considered to be those patients in the ICU or in need of ventilators.
医療機関等が行った検査も含む: Figures include testing by medical institutions, etc.
保健所から発生届が提出された日を基準とする: Based on the day of notification from the public health centers
チャーター機帰国者、クルーズ船乗客等は含まれていない: Figures exclude those on repatriation flights and cruise ship passengers.
5月11日までの入院患者数には宿泊療養者・自宅療養者等を含んでいるため、参考値で: The number of inpatients up to May 11th includes accommodation and home care patients, so it is a reference value.
集団感染発生や曜日による数値のばらつきにより、日々の結果が変動するため、こうした: The positive rate here is a 7-day moving average that evens out the day-to-day variation caused by mass infections and other factors, for the purpose of overall trend analysis with line graph (e.g. the positive rate of May 7th is calculated by the average during the 1st to 7th of May.)
本グラフは、新たなモニタリング項目から除外されたこと、日々公開している陽性者数か: This graph will be deleted as of July 17, as it has been excluded from the new index of monitorings.
速報値として公開するものであり、後日確定データとして修正される場合がある: These are preliminary figures and may be revised at a later date as confirmed data.
5月13日以降は、PCR検査に加え、抗原検査の件数を含む: Starting May 13th, this includes both PCR tests and antigen tests.
検体採取日を基準とする。ただし、一部検査結果判明日に基づくものを含む: Based on the date of sample collection, but may also include tests based on the day the test results came out.
同一の対象者について複数の検体を検査する場合がある: More than one sample from the same subject may be tested.
患者発生の動向をより正確に分析するため、各保健所から報告があった患者の発生情報を: In order to more accurately analyze the trend of the outbreak, the occurrence of infected people confirmed by their doctor was reported from each health center by PCR test each day (per confirmed date)
新型コロナ受診相談窓口 （帰国者・接触者電話相談センター）を開設した2月7日から: The graph starts from Feb 7th, when the Tokyo COVID-19 Consultation Hotline (for Returnees and Potential Contact Persons) was opened.
曜日などによる数値のばらつきにより、日々の結果が変動するため、こうしたばらつきを: The moving averages for the past 7 days are shown as a line graph for the purpose of leveling these variations and looking at the overall trend. (ex. the May 7th moving average for the day is the average of the actual values from 1st May to 7th May.) The moving average is used because daily results fluctuate due to variations in the number of cases depending on the day of the week, etc.
保健所から発生届が提出された日別（報告日別）の新規陽性者について、接触歴等の不明: Daily new positive cases (by day of notification) reported by the public health centers were divided into untraceable cases and traceable cases.
増加比は、１週間前の接触歴等不明者数（移動平均値）との比較: The increase rate is a comparison with the moving average of untraceable cases one week before.
濃厚接触者など、患者の発生状況の内訳の公表を開始した3月27日から作成: The graph starts from March 27, from which the breakdown of patients (such as infections from close contacts) is published
集団感染発生や曜日による数値のばらつきにより、日々の結果が変動するため、こうした: The positive rate here is a 7-day moving average that evens out the day-to-day variation caused by mass infections and other factors, for the purpose of overall trend analysis. (e.g. the positive rate of 7th May is calculated by the average during 1st to 7th May.)
5月13日から6月16日までに行われた抗原検査については、結果が陰性の場合、PC: Cases testing negative in antigen tests conducted from May 13 through June 16 required a PCR test for confirmation, so in order to avoid duplication of test figures, only those testing positive were included in the calculation. For antigen tests conducted from June 17, both cases testing positive and negative are included in the calculations.
陽性率：陽性判明数（PCR・抗原）の移動平均／検査人数（＝陽性判明数（PCR・抗: Positivity rate: Moving average of cases testing positive (PCR/antigen) divided by the moving average of cases tested (confirmed positive cases (PCR/antigen) and confirmed negative cases (PCR/antigen))

(e.g. the positive rate of 7th May is calculated by the average during 1st to 7th May.)

(2)(4)(5)は報告日の前日時点の数値: (2), (4), and (5) are figures from the day before the reported date

(6)確保病床：レベル1→1,000床、レベル2→3,000床、レベル3→4,0: (6) Number of beds for serious patients: Level 1: 1,000 beds -> Level 2: 3,000 beds -> Level 3: 4,000 beds
(6)の確保病床数には、(7)の確保病床数を含む: The number of beds for (6) includes (7) the number of beds for patients with severe symptoms
体制強化が必要であると思われる: The system must be built up.
毎週、専門家による状況分析を項目ごとに行い、都内の感染状況と医療提供体制それぞれ: Each week, experts analyze the situation for each indicator and give a 4-level overall comment for the infecion situation and the health care provision system, respectively.
{date}付の総括コメントは以下のとおりです。: Their comments on {date} are as follows.
東京都では、都内の「感染状況」と「医療提供体制」を2つの柱として7つのモニタリン: The Tokyo Metropolitan Government has established two main monitoring categories, the infection situation and the system for health care provision, under which seven indicators are monitored.
感染状況・医療提供体制の分析: Analyses of the infection situation and the system for health care provision

届出保健所別の内訳: Cases by public health center location
退院者数の把握には一定の期間を要しており、確認次第数値を更新している: Discharge figures are updated once confirmed since some time is needed to grasp the numbers.
「重症」は、人工呼吸器管理（ECMOを含む）が必要な患者数を計上: Severe cases are those requiring respiratory support, including ECMO.
東京都ステッカー申請・感染拡大防止協力金相談センター: Tokyo Metropolis Sticker Application / Infection Spread Prevention Support Fund Call Center
感染防止徹底宣言ステッカー、感染拡大防止協力金等に関すること: About COVID-19 Safety Sticker and Infection Spread Prevention Support Fund
発症日不明者（検査結果が陽性であっても症状がない、発症日を覚えていないなど）はグ: The graph excludes those whose date of symptom onset is unknown due to reasons such as being asymptomatic although testing positive, or not remembering when symptoms appeared.
発症日別による陽性者数の推移: Positive cases by day of symptom onset
各保健所から報告があった患者の発生情報を、発症日別に整理したものである: Information on case onsets reported by the public health centers has been arranged by date of symptom onset.
発症日不明者 {num} 人を除く: Excludes {num} whose date of symptom onset is unknown

発症日別による陽性者数の推移はこちら: See change in positive cases by day of symptom onset
各保健所から報告があった患者の発生情報を、検査により陽性であることを医師が確認し: Information on case onsets reported by the public health centers has been arranged by the day when a physician confirmed that the patient was positive through testing (date of confirmation).
前日までに報告された陽性者数の累計値: Cumulative no. of positive cases reported up to the previous day
{number}：急病やけがの際に、緊急受診の必要性や診察可能な医療機関をアドバ: {number}: telephone consultation service to advise on the necessity of emergency care and available medical institutions in case of sudden illness or injury
東京都家賃等支援給付金: Tokyo Metropolitan Government Rental Assistance Grant
事業者における家賃等の負担を軽減し、事業の継続を下支えするため、国の家賃支援給付: In order to support business continuity by lightening the burden of rental payments, etc., the Tokyo Metropolitan Government is offering its own rental assistance grant (three months worth of rent) that can supplement the central government's rental assistance grant.
「重症」は、人工呼吸器管理（ECMOを含む）が必要な患者数を計上。: Severe cases are those requiring respiratory support, including ECMO.
入院患者数のうち、人工呼吸器管理（ECMOを含む）が必要な患者数を計上。: Among hospitalized patients, these are patients requiring respiratory support, including ECMO.
新型コロナウイルス感染拡大防止のため、酒類の提供を行う飲食店及びカラオケ店に対す: Tokyo will provide aid by fund to small and medium-sized businesses with restaurants and karaoke stores that provide alcoholic that fully cooperate requests to shorten business hours to prevent the spread of COVID-19.
感染の再拡大に警戒が必要であると思われる: Vigilance against a resurgence of the virus is needed.
感染の再拡大に注意が必要であると思われる: Caution against a resurgence of the virus is needed.
感染者数の増加が一定程度にとどまっていると思われる: The increase in new infected cases is being contained to a certain degree.
体制強化の状態を維持する必要があると思われる: The current built-up system must be maintained.
通常の体制で対応可能であると思われる: Response is possible under the current system.
死亡日別による死亡者数の推移はこちら: Click here for number of deaths by date of death.
東京都では、都内の「感染状況」と「医療提供体制」を2つの柱として7つのモニタリン: Tokyo Metropolitan government provides 7 monitoring items based on "The Infection Trends in Tokyo" and "Medical System Provisions". Every week specialists analyze circumstances of each monitoring item and assess by 4 grade evaluation as "Summarization Comment" about each of The Infection Trends in Tokyo and Medical System Provisions. このサイトの内容物は{creativeCommons}の下に提供されています。: Content on this site is provided under a {creativeCommons}Attribution 4.0 International License
営業時間短縮に係る感染拡大防止協力金（９月実施分）: Infection Spread Prevention Support Fund (for shortened business hours in September)
新型コロナウイルス感染拡大防止のため、特別区内の酒類の提供を行う飲食店及びカラオ: Payments are provided to small and medium sized businesses that cooperated fully with the request made by the Tokyo Metropolitan Government to karaoke establishments and places serving alcoholic beverages operating in the 23-ward area to shorten their business hours in order to help prevent the spread of infection.
新型コロナウイルス感染症の患者発生状況に関するよくあるご質問: FAQs concerning the information on this site

10月30日（金曜日）17時から「東京都発熱相談センター」の開設に伴い、「新型コ: Due to the establishment of the Tokyo Fever Consultation Center on Friday, October 30, 2020 at 5 p.m., the Novel Coronavirus Hotline was discontinued. This graph is currently undergoing revision to reflect the change.
東京iCDC（東京感染症対策センター）からのお知らせ: Information from the Tokyo iCDC (Tokyo Center for Infectious Disease Control and Prevention）
東京都では、都内の「感染状況」と「医療提供体制」を2つの柱として7つのモニタリン: The Tokyo Metropolitan Government has established two main monitoring categories, the infection situation and the system for health care provision, under which seven indicators are monitored. Each week, experts analyze the situation for each indicator and give a 4-level overall comment for the infection situation and the health care provision system, respectively. The latest comments are shown below.
英語を使う楽しさを体感できる動画コンテンツを、小学生・中学生・高校生向けに順次配: Videos for elementary, junior high, and high school students which allow them to experience the fun of using English are being added regularly.
感染が拡大しつつあると思われる: The infection is starting to spread.
「職業」「接触歴」「発症日」「確定日」は、10月1日以降の情報について週１回更新: From October 1, "Occupation," "Contact history," "Date of onset," and "Date of confirmation" data are updated once a week.
「確定日」は検査により陽性であることを医師が確認した日: "Date of confirmation" is the day a doctor confirmed that the patient tested positive.
「退院」は、保健所から報告があり、確認ができているものを反映（死亡退院を含む）: "Discharged" are cases that were reported from the public health centers and confirmed (includes deaths).
曜日などによる数値のばらつきにより、日々の結果が変動するため、こうしたばらつきを: The moving averages for the past 7 days are shown as a line graph for the purpose of leveling variations due to factors such as the day of the week and showing the overall trend. (e.g. the moving average for Nov. 16 is the average of the actual values from Nov. 10 to 16.)

営業時間短縮に係る感染拡大防止協力金（12/18～1/7実施分）: Payment for Cooperation in Preventing the Spread of Infection (for shortened business hours from Dec. 18 to Jan. 7)
東京都緊急事態措置等・感染拡大防止協力金等に関すること: Matters related to TMG State of Emergency Measures and Payment for Cooperation in Preventing the Spread of Infection
新型コロナウイルス感染拡大防止のため、緊急事態宣言が発令され、営業時間短縮が強化: Since a state of emergency has been declared and requests to shorten business hours have been strengthened to prevent the spread of COVID-19, a new round of payments will be provided to restaurants and other establishments that cooperate fully with requests made by the Tokyo Metropolitan Government.
2020年5月13日以降は、PCR検査に加え、抗原検査の件数を含む: From May 13, 2020, includes antigen tests in addition to PCR tests.
曜日などによる数値のばらつきにより、日々の結果が変動するため、こうしたばらつきを: Because of day-to-day variance of results due to the day of the week, the 7-day moving average is plotted on the graph to level out these differences and show the overall trend (e.g., the Nov. 7, 2020 moving average is the average of actual figures from Nov. 1 through Nov 7, 2020).
「職業」「接触歴」「発症日」「確定日」は、2020年10月1日以降の情報について: From October 1, 2020, "Occupation," "Contact history," and "Date of confirmation" data are updated once a week.
2020年5月7日以降は(1)東京都健康安全研究センター、(2)PCRセンター（: From May 7, 2020, calculations are based on results of health insurance-covered tests conducted at (1) Tokyo Metropolitan Institute of Public Health, (2) PCR centers (local outpatient and testing centers), and (3) medical institutions. Data from April 10 through May 6, 2020 is only for (1) and (2) and does not include (3), and data from April 9, 2020 and before includes only (1) and not (2) or (3).
曜日などによる数値のばらつきにより、日々の結果が変動するため、こうしたばらつきを: Because of day-to-day variance of results due to the day of the week, the 7-day moving average is plotted on the graph to level out these differences and show the overall trend (e.g., the May 7, 2020 moving average is the average of actual figures from May 1 through May 7, 2020).
上記の考え方で重症患者数の計上を開始した2020年4月27日から作成: The graph starts from April 27, 2020 when figures for severe patients were first tabulated based on the above description.
2020年5月11日までの入院患者数には宿泊療養者・自宅療養者等を含んでいるため: Figures for hospitalized patients up to May 11, 2020 are provided for reference only as they include those recovering at designated hotels or at home.
当サイトにおいて入院患者数の公表を開始した2020年3月6日から作成: The graph starts from March 6, 2020 when the number of hospitalized patients was first released on this website.
新型コロナ受診相談窓口 （帰国者・接触者電話相談センター）を開設した2020年2: The graph starts from Feb, 7, 2020 when the Novel Coronavirus Hotline (for returnees and those in contact with infected patients) was opened.
集団感染発生や曜日による数値のばらつきにより、日々の結果が変動するため、こうした: Because of day-to-day variance of results due to cluster outbreaks and day of the week, to level out these differences and show the overall trend, the 7-day moving average is calculated as the number of untraceable cases (e.g., the May 7, 2020 moving average is the average of actual figures from May 1 through May 7, 2020).

Because of day-to-day variance of results due to cluster outbreaks and day of the week, the 7-day moving average is plotted on the graph to level out these differences and show the overall trend (e.g., the May 7, 2020 moving average is the average of actual figures from May 1 through May 7, 2020).
2020年5月13日から2020年6月16日までに行われた抗原検査については、結: Cases testing negative in antigen tests conducted from May 13 through June 16, 2020 required a PCR test for confirmation, so in order to avoid duplication of test figures, only those testing positive were included in the calculation. For antigen tests conducted from June 17, 2020, both cases testing positive and negative are included in the calculations.
陽性者が2020年1月24日、25日、30日、2月13日にそれぞれ1名、2月14: One positive case was confirmed on Jan. 24, 25, 30, and Feb. 13, 2020, respectively, and two cases on February 14, 2020, but the graph starts from February 15, 2020 when significant figures became available.
「東京都発熱相談センター」の開設に伴い、「新型コロナ受診相談窓口」は終了したため: Due to the establishment of the Tokyo Fever Consultation Center, the Novel Coronavirus Hotline was discontinued. As such, updates of this graph have been terminated from Friday, Oct. 30, 2020, at 5 p.m.
集団感染発生や曜日による数値のばらつきにより、日々の結果が変動するため、こうした: Because of day-to-day variance of results due to cluster outbreaks and day of the week, the 7-day moving average is plotted on the graph to level out these differences and show the overall trend (e.g., the May 7, 2020 moving average is the average of actual figures from May 1 through May 7, 2020).
東京都発熱相談センターを開設した2020年10月30日17時から作成: Prepared since establishment of the Tokyo Fever Consultation Center on Oct. 30, 2020, 5 p.m.
濃厚接触者など、患者の発生状況の内訳の公表を開始した2020年3月27日から作成: The graph starts from March 27, 2020, when details of the cases, such as close contact with an infected person, began to be released.
